trans-unit.source: Get information about the specified task.
trans-unit.target: Get information about the specified task.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="0e07b9cb-8fdf-4ff7-b707-e964200df0f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers</link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to tasks.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="0e07b9cb-8fdf-4ff7-b707-e964200df0f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers</link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to tasks.

trans-unit.source: Replace {job-id} with the id of the job that contains the task.
trans-unit.target: Replace {job-id} with the id of the job that contains the task.

trans-unit.source: Replace {task-id} with the id of the task that you want to get information about.
trans-unit.target: Replace {task-id} with the id of the task that you want to get information about.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e9da2d54-053a-4392-a5ba-26229c7cc9a5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e9da2d54-053a-4392-a5ba-26229c7cc9a5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows information about a completed task:
trans-unit.target: The following example shows information about a completed task:

trans-unit.source: The display name of the task
trans-unit.target: The display name of the task

trans-unit.source: You can use it to detect whether the task has changed between requests.
trans-unit.target: You can use it to detect whether the task has changed between requests.

trans-unit.source: In particular, you can be pass the ETag with an Update Task request to specify that your changes should take effect only if nobody else has modified the job in the meantime.
trans-unit.target: In particular, you can be pass the ETag with an Update Task request to specify that your changes should take effect only if nobody else has modified the job in the meantime.

trans-unit.source: The last modified time of the task.
trans-unit.target: The last modified time of the task.

trans-unit.source: The creation time of the task.
trans-unit.target: The creation time of the task.

trans-unit.source: The current state of the task.
trans-unit.target: The current state of the task.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>active</languageKeyword> – The task is queued and able to run, but is not currently assigned to a compute node.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>active</languageKeyword> – The task is queued and able to run, but is not currently assigned to a compute node.

trans-unit.source: A task enters this state when it is created, when it is enabled after being disabled, or when it is awaiting a retry after a failed run.
trans-unit.target: A task enters this state when it is created, when it is enabled after being disabled, or when it is awaiting a retry after a failed run.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>preparing</languageKeyword> – The task has been assigned to a compute node, but is waiting for a required Job Preparation task to complete on the node.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>preparing</languageKeyword> – The task has been assigned to a compute node, but is waiting for a required Job Preparation task to complete on the node.

trans-unit.source: If the Job Preparation task succeeds, the task will move to <languageKeyword>running</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: If the Job Preparation task succeeds, the task will move to <languageKeyword>running</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: If the Job Preparation task fails, the task will return to <languageKeyword>active</languageKeyword> and will be eligible to be assigned to a different node.
trans-unit.target: If the Job Preparation task fails, the task will return to <languageKeyword>active</languageKeyword> and will be eligible to be assigned to a different node.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>running</languageKeyword> – The task is running on a compute node.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>running</languageKeyword> – The task is running on a compute node.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> – The task is no longer eligible to run, usually because the task has finished successfully, or the task has finished unsuccessfully and has exhausted its retry limit.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> – The task is no longer eligible to run, usually because the task has finished successfully, or the task has finished unsuccessfully and has exhausted its retry limit.

trans-unit.source: A task is also marked as completed if an error occurred launching the task, or when the task has been terminated (see <link xlink:href="b7355d75-5483-480e-be47-7a9598ebca44" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Terminate a task</link>).
trans-unit.target: A task is also marked as completed if an error occurred launching the task, or when the task has been terminated (see <link xlink:href="b7355d75-5483-480e-be47-7a9598ebca44" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Terminate a task</link>).

trans-unit.source: The time at which the task entered its current state.
trans-unit.target: The time at which the task entered its current state.

trans-unit.source: The previous state of the task.
trans-unit.target: The previous state of the task.

trans-unit.source: This property is not present if the task is in its initial active state.
trans-unit.target: This property is not present if the task is in its initial active state.

trans-unit.source: The time at which the task entered its previous state.
trans-unit.target: The time at which the task entered its previous state.

trans-unit.source: This property is not present if the task is in its initial active state.
trans-unit.target: This property is not present if the task is in its initial active state.

trans-unit.source: The command line of the task.
trans-unit.target: The command line of the task.

trans-unit.source: A list of files that Batch will download to the compute node before running the command line.
trans-unit.target: A list of files that Batch will download to the compute node before running the command line.

trans-unit.source: A list of environment variable settings for the task.
trans-unit.target: A list of environment variable settings for the task.

trans-unit.source: A locality hint that can be used by the Batch service to select a node on which to start the new task.
trans-unit.target: A locality hint that can be used by the Batch service to select a node on which to start the new task.

trans-unit.source: The execution constraints that apply to this task.
trans-unit.target: The execution constraints that apply to this task.

trans-unit.source: Specifies if the task is configured to run with elevated permissions.
trans-unit.target: Specifies if the task is configured to run with elevated permissions.

trans-unit.source: Contains information about the execution of the task.
trans-unit.target: Contains information about the execution of the task.

trans-unit.source: Contains information about the compute node on which the task ran.
trans-unit.target: Contains information about the compute node on which the task ran.

trans-unit.source: Contains resource usage statistics for the task.
trans-unit.target: Contains resource usage statistics for the task.

trans-unit.source: The URL of a blob in Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: The URL of a blob in Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: The Batch service downloads the blob to the specified file path.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service downloads the blob to the specified file path.

trans-unit.source: The URL must be readable using anonymous access; that is, the Batch service does not present any credentials when downloading the blob.
trans-unit.target: The URL must be readable using anonymous access; that is, the Batch service does not present any credentials when downloading the blob.

trans-unit.source: There are two ways to get such a URL for a blob in Azure storage:
trans-unit.target: There are two ways to get such a URL for a blob in Azure storage:

trans-unit.source: Use a Shared Access Signature (SAS) granting read permissions on the blob.
trans-unit.target: Use a Shared Access Signature (SAS) granting read permissions on the blob.

trans-unit.source: Set the ACL for the blob’s container to allow public access.
trans-unit.target: Set the ACL for the blob’s container to allow public access.

trans-unit.source: The location on the compute node to which the file should be downloaded.
trans-unit.target: The location on the compute node to which the file should be downloaded.

trans-unit.source: The name of the environment variable.
trans-unit.target: The name of the environment variable.

trans-unit.source: The value of the environment variable.
trans-unit.target: The value of the environment variable.

trans-unit.source: An opaque string representing the location of compute node or a task that has run previously.
trans-unit.target: An opaque string representing the location of compute node or a task that has run previously.

trans-unit.source: You can pass the affinityId of a compute node or task to indicate that this task needs to be placed close to the node or task.
trans-unit.target: You can pass the affinityId of a compute node or task to indicate that this task needs to be placed close to the node or task.

trans-unit.source: You can obtain the affinityId for a node or a task via a GET request for that resource.
trans-unit.target: You can obtain the affinityId for a node or a task via a GET request for that resource.

trans-unit.source: The maximum elapsed time that the job may run, measured from the time the job is created.
trans-unit.target: The maximum elapsed time that the job may run, measured from the time the job is created.

trans-unit.source: If the job does not complete within the time limit, the Batch service terminates it (and any tasks that are still running).
trans-unit.target: If the job does not complete within the time limit, the Batch service terminates it (and any tasks that are still running).

trans-unit.source: In this case, the termination reason will be <legacyItalic>maxWallClockTimeExpiry</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the termination reason will be <legacyItalic>maxWallClockTimeExpiry</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: If this is not specified, there is no time limit on how long the job may run.
trans-unit.target: If this is not specified, there is no time limit on how long the job may run.

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of times each task may be retried.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of times each task may be retried.

trans-unit.source: The Batch service retries a task if its exit code is nonzero.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service retries a task if its exit code is nonzero.

trans-unit.source: Note that this value specifically controls the number of retries.
trans-unit.target: Note that this value specifically controls the number of retries.

trans-unit.source: The Batch service will try each task once, and may then retry up to this limit.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service will try each task once, and may then retry up to this limit.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the maximum retry count is 3, Batch tries a task up to 4 times (one initial try and 3 retries).
trans-unit.target: For example, if the maximum retry count is 3, Batch tries a task up to 4 times (one initial try and 3 retries).

trans-unit.source: If the maximum retry count is 0, the Batch service does not retry tasks.
trans-unit.target: If the maximum retry count is 0, the Batch service does not retry tasks.

trans-unit.source: If the maximum retry count is -1, the Batch service retries tasks without limit.
trans-unit.target: If the maximum retry count is -1, the Batch service retries tasks without limit.

trans-unit.source: The time in which the working directory for the task is retained.
trans-unit.target: The time in which the working directory for the task is retained.

trans-unit.source: The time at which the task started running.
trans-unit.target: The time at which the task started running.

trans-unit.source: If the task has been restarted or retried, this is the most recent time at which the task started running.This property is present only for tasks that are in the <languageKeyword>running</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> state.
trans-unit.target: If the task has been restarted or retried, this is the most recent time at which the task started running.This property is present only for tasks that are in the <languageKeyword>running</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> state.

trans-unit.source: The time at which the task completed.
trans-unit.target: The time at which the task completed.

trans-unit.source: This property is only returned if the task is in <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> state.
trans-unit.target: This property is only returned if the task is in <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> state.

trans-unit.source: The exit code of the task.
trans-unit.target: The exit code of the task.

trans-unit.source: This property is only returned if the task is in <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> state.
trans-unit.target: This property is only returned if the task is in <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> state.

trans-unit.source: If there was an error scheduling the task, and the task is now in a <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> state, this element contains the error details.
trans-unit.target: If there was an error scheduling the task, and the task is now in a <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> state, this element contains the error details.

trans-unit.source: The number of times the task has been retried by the Batch service.
trans-unit.target: The number of times the task has been retried by the Batch service.

trans-unit.source: The task is retried if it exits with a nonzero exit code, up to the specified MaxTaskRetryCount
trans-unit.target: The task is retried if it exits with a nonzero exit code, up to the specified MaxTaskRetryCount

trans-unit.source: The most recent time at which a retry of the task started running.
trans-unit.target: The most recent time at which a retry of the task started running.

trans-unit.source: This element is present only if the task was retried (i.e. retryCount is nonzero).
trans-unit.target: This element is present only if the task was retried (i.e. retryCount is nonzero).

trans-unit.source: If present, this is typically the same as startTime, but may be different if the task has been restarted for reasons other than retry; for example, if the compute node was rebooted during a retry, then the startTime is updated but the lastRetryTime is not.
trans-unit.target: If present, this is typically the same as startTime, but may be different if the task has been restarted for reasons other than retry; for example, if the compute node was rebooted during a retry, then the startTime is updated but the lastRetryTime is not.

trans-unit.source: The number of times the task has been requeued by the Batch service as the result of a user request.
trans-unit.target: The number of times the task has been requeued by the Batch service as the result of a user request.

trans-unit.source: When the user removes nodes from a pool (by resizing/shrinking the pool) or when the job is being disabled, the user can specify that running tasks on the nodes be requeued for execution.
trans-unit.target: When the user removes nodes from a pool (by resizing/shrinking the pool) or when the job is being disabled, the user can specify that running tasks on the nodes be requeued for execution.

trans-unit.source: This count tracks how many times the task has been requeued for these reasons.
trans-unit.target: This count tracks how many times the task has been requeued for these reasons.

trans-unit.source: The most recent time at which the task has been requeued by the Batch service as the result of a user request.
trans-unit.target: The most recent time at which the task has been requeued by the Batch service as the result of a user request.

trans-unit.source: This property is present only if the requeueCount is nonzero.
trans-unit.target: This property is present only if the requeueCount is nonzero.

trans-unit.source: The category of the task scheduling error.
trans-unit.target: The category of the task scheduling error.

trans-unit.source: An identifier for the task scheduling error.
trans-unit.target: An identifier for the task scheduling error.

trans-unit.source: Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.
trans-unit.target: Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

trans-unit.source: A message describing the task scheduling error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.
trans-unit.target: A message describing the task scheduling error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

trans-unit.source: A list of additional error details related to the scheduling error.
trans-unit.target: A list of additional error details related to the scheduling error.

trans-unit.source: An identifier for the compute node on which the task ran, which can be passed in the Add Task API to request that the task be scheduled close to this compute node.
trans-unit.target: An identifier for the compute node on which the task ran, which can be passed in the Add Task API to request that the task be scheduled close to this compute node.

trans-unit.source: The URL of the node on which the task ran.
trans-unit.target: The URL of the node on which the task ran.

trans-unit.source: The id of the pool on which the task ran.
trans-unit.target: The id of the pool on which the task ran.

trans-unit.source: The id of the node on which the task ran
trans-unit.target: The id of the node on which the task ran

trans-unit.source: The start time of the time range covered by the statistics.
trans-unit.target: The start time of the time range covered by the statistics.

trans-unit.source: The time at which the statistics were last updated.
trans-unit.target: The time at which the statistics were last updated.

trans-unit.source: All statistics are limited to the range between startTime and lastUpdateTime.
trans-unit.target: All statistics are limited to the range between startTime and lastUpdateTime.

trans-unit.source: The total user mode CPU time (summed across all cores and all compute nodes) consumed by the task.
trans-unit.target: The total user mode CPU time (summed across all cores and all compute nodes) consumed by the task.

trans-unit.source: The total kernel mode CPU time (summed across all cores and all compute nodes) consumed by the task.
trans-unit.target: The total kernel mode CPU time (summed across all cores and all compute nodes) consumed by the task.

trans-unit.source: The total wall clock time of the task.
trans-unit.target: The total wall clock time of the task.

trans-unit.source: The wall clock time is the elapsed time from when the task started running on a compute node to when it finished (or to the last time the statistics were updated, if the task had not finished by then).
trans-unit.target: The wall clock time is the elapsed time from when the task started running on a compute node to when it finished (or to the last time the statistics were updated, if the task had not finished by then).

trans-unit.source: If the task was retried, this includes the wall clock time of all the task retries.
trans-unit.target: If the task was retried, this includes the wall clock time of all the task retries.

trans-unit.source: The total number of I/O read operations performed by the task.
trans-unit.target: The total number of I/O read operations performed by the task.

trans-unit.source: The total number of I/O write operations performed by the task.
trans-unit.target: The total number of I/O write operations performed by the task.

trans-unit.source: The total amount of data (in GB) of I/O read by the task.
trans-unit.target: The total amount of data (in GB) of I/O read by the task.

trans-unit.source: The total amount of data (in GB) of I/O written by the task.
trans-unit.target: The total amount of data (in GB) of I/O written by the task.

trans-unit.source: The elapsed time between the creation of the task creation and the start of task execution.
trans-unit.target: The elapsed time between the creation of the task creation and the start of task execution.

trans-unit.source: (If the task is retried due to failures, the wait time is the time to the most recent task execution.)
trans-unit.target: (If the task is retried due to failures, the wait time is the time to the most recent task execution.)
